name: Prescribing of gabapentin and pregabalin (approximate pregabalin equivalence)
title: Prescribing of gabapentin and pregabalin (approximate pregabalin equivalence) per 1000 patients
description: Total mg of pregabalin + total mg/6 of gabapentin per 1000 patients
why_it_matters: Gabapentin and pregabalin are increasingly used in neuropathic and other types of pain, and use is rising rapidly in the NHS.
There are also concerns about the potential for abuse.  There appears to be no robust mechanism for converting gabapentin to
pregabalin. Toth et al describe using a <a href='https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20113408'>6mg:1mg ratio for gabapentin to
pregabalin. The DDD for gabapentin is also 6 times that of pregabalin. This measure is therefore based on gabapentin total
milligrams / 6, as well as total milligrams for pregabalin.
Please note that this is an experimental measure. We would be grateful for any feedback at
numerator_short: Gabapentin total quantity prescribed (in mg) /6 + pregabalin total quantity prescribed (in mg)
